Feeling like a King and/or Queen. The palace square in front of the Hermitage gives you a feeling of grandeur. The square is nicely situated between the river and the city center. It is an attraction itself. Statues and nicely decorated buildings all around.

Huge, impressive, amazing !. Impressive place, huge building of the Hermitage Museum, very beautiful and worth to see. If you have time, take some to get into the museum! You have to pay for a ticket but you can use it for all the museums in that square !

Must see even if you are in St. Petersburg for 3 hours. This is the central square of St. Petersburg and it is must see even if you are in town for few hours. You can make great pictures at sunset or right after it.
Picture-perfect square . There is nothing here to do other than enjoy the architecture and do people-watching - but hey, that's what a great square is all about, right?

Huge Square and Windy. This Square lies between yellow and green building. The green building is hermitage museum, all around the square full of artistic building. But if you one of visitor who visiting hermitage museum and queuing here, my suggestion you need bring jacket cause very windy around here. A small shop sell some souvenir also around here and she/he sell unique souvenir. Beside souvenir around this area have people who wear Victoria gown so you can photo with him or her and pay some Ruble them. But if your ruble is limited just used for another adventure like try jetfoil behind the hermitage
Must see.. The first time you enter the square you know why you chose to visit St Petersburg. Space, stunning buildings, incredible scale and symmetry.

“An extraordinary square”. An extraordinary square, full of history and class, it is surrounded by grand buildings. One side is the General Staff Building and the other side is the Winter Palace, in the middle is the Alexander Column. It’s a place that’s worth your time to visit even if just for a short time.Happy travelling!

The first place for visiting in St.Petersburg. I think that is first place for visiting in St.Petersburg. And of course you will need go to Hermitage museum, which shock the vast variety and majority of pictures, sculptures and other subject of art.

Breath taking. The square is certainly one of the most majestic in Europe. Perfectly restored and reserved to pedestrians. Therefore it is a quiet pleasure to stroll around (only disturbed by groups of tourists...)

Incredible . Always told that this was a beautiful place and now I see why and agree. Incredible buildings and so much history. A must see and place to saviour so much history. Do the walking tour but avoid the others. Just visit as it is better value and at your pace.

A must to see. Get your tickets from machine saves waiting in que. Ensure you have easy shoes on as there is lots of walking , plenty to see and enjoy.
Cafe's downstairs.
Impressive!. Huge, impressive large city square, open space to walk on or ride a carriage, beautiful both day and night.

Beautiful. One of my favourite places to visit while in SPB! It is pretty in the summer and in the winter. Great place to walk around and take pictures of the historic Palace Square. If you come to St. Petersburg then you must come to this awesome place! You will not be disappointed.

Beautiful, but beware of taxi cabs from this area. Beautiful. Great place to people watch. Convenient public toilet cost for use is 30 rubles. But, beware of taxi cabs waiting around square. It cost us more to take one of these cabs less than a mile to our hotel, than it cost us to take a private car in from the airport. The meters are jacked to exorbitant prices.
Beautiful Sight. We toured while on a Viking Star cruise. This square is very big. Beautiful site worth a visit. the photos attached were taken from the building across the square.

The creation of Carlo Rossi-the air movement!. The creation of Carlo Rossi-the air movement! The classical layout of the main square of St. Petersburg,between the Hermitage and General staff building,in the center column in honor of Alexander the First,Emperor.
Nice place to go . It is a very big area with many Magnificent building around there. U can have a create view of winter palace. It is very crowded during the weekend.

Incredible. Wow. Just wow.
We got there early in the morning, before the Hermitage and Staff Building were open so it was empty.
This was our first morning, and I got a real 'take-your-breath-away' moment of "we're in St Petersburg" and "this is where it all happened". A very special moment and unmissable.

Well it shows what it is. Very nice place, full of activities. You get a feeling of what it would have been years back. very well kept and very rich history. A place I will remember forever. A definite visit if you are in St. Petersburg.

A spacious setting for excess. The Hermitage is so huge it needs space to hold it and to give it presence. The river provides the backdrop and this square the magnificence. At once a feature and a potential military parade ground it is enormous with the Hermitage filling one side and the administrative buildings opposite with a grand obelisk in its centre it is the imposing expanse required to complete the overall impression of omnipotent royalty.
Open space for relaxation. The square opens up to winter palace and is right in the middle of the city off Nevsky Prospect. This is a great meeting spot or place to admire the beauty of the palace.

Beautiful place in central Saint-Petersburg. It is a really beautiful place to visit in Saint-Petersburg by yourself, but I would strongly recommend to take a guide who will tell you a lot about the history of the "Northern Venice". The best times of the year to visit are winter (yes, with snow and -30C, so take warm clothes) or summer nights (white nights in June and early July).
Takes the breath away!. We visited this magnificent place on a very cold (-12) but sunny day. With the snow on the ground it was mystical and we felt privileged to be there
You will feel like a Szar. Majestic Square covered in fresh snow, a peaceful walk feeling like a Szar in the immensity of this big square, nice ambient with local tourist.

Beautiful in the Snow. This is a beautiful square surrounded by stunning buildings.We visited in February and the snow just added to the picture we saw.Lots of street vendors selling everything from mink hats to vodja to caviar. I would advise caution as given the prices, they may not be genuine

Great Place. Having there in winter February 2016, the place all covered by snow, can you imagine how beautifull the place with all white snow covering the yard.Palace Square is a place to meet for St Peterburg people, its also a tourist destination, you can also go to Hermitage museum from this place.Unfortunadtely there are no cafe for me to just hang out.... there are only 2 coffe stall near the place.

Beautiful Year Round. Had the good fortune to visit during the winter in the middle of a snowstorm. It's a stunningly gorgeous location with the State Hermitage Museum on one side and Alexander Column in the center. Be sure to visit at night.

Beautiful . Beautiful and central site, during the summer, there is many shows, local contests (bands, dancing and etc) and tourists activities. Recommended as a start point for a walk tour at Nevsky prospect.
Red Square Eat Your Heart Out!. I'm not sure if it's bigger than Red Square but it's grander and more beautiful. Approach through the triumphal arch for maximum wow factor.
Impreial Grandeur. Stunning setting flanked by the imposing arch of The General Staff Building on one side and the chocolate box exterior of The Hermitage on the other.

Breathtaking . Breathtaking not just because of the extreme cold in February... This square is huge and pictures cannot do its beauty justice. It gives you a great view of the hermitage, the winter palace and the war memorial/military buildings.
Beware, it is very exposed and therefore cold & icy in winter (we slipped on multiple occasions).

Stunning colors. I loved that all of St. Petersburg had stunning colors. The Palace Square was a wonderful example of Russian Baroque architecture and Neoclassical architecture. If you are in any way interested in buildings, go here.

Gorgeous place to see. I went with my husband and children, we where absolutely amazed !!
Stunning
I recommend this place and takes long hours to see it all!
I would get back one day
Large open square. Difficult to describe but beautiful view of the Winter Palace and war memorial. Can get cold here in Winter with breeze from river close by
Wow!. We saw this on the snow and the light broke to provide beautiful photos. "Cinderella" horse drawn carriages and people dressed in period costume. A bit touristy, but still a fantastic square.
True heart of the city. One of the most beautiful areas of the city. Surrounded by Hermitage and The Headquaters. Concerts are oftenly held here

Hidden gem. It's in the same compound as Hermitage Museum and with the same admission tickets. Hidden in the gallery are Grand Master artworks. Saw my 1st Van Gough, up close (1 arm lenght away). plus many others.

Lovely place to stop ahd take in the vviews. It was snowing when we visited, so the whole square had a feel of fairytale about it. The area is huge and your imagination does not have much work to do to envisage the carriages and processions that used to take place here.
Absolutely Must See. Gorgeous Place, very pretty. Palace is magnificent. A spectacular, especially when the weather is nice. Inside huge collection of arts, artifacts, etc. All day event.

Just as picturesque in the snow!. We walked through Palace Square when walking into and exiting the Hermitage. It was under a blanket of snow with plenty of people pottering about, souvenir and coffee stalls about to get a little something to bring home and a hot drink.
Beautiful at day and amazing at night. We briefly visited the square when we went to the Hermitage museum, but we returned later and its amazing at night, the lights give it another look.
Stunning View. A must see view of saint petersburg. If only for the view and the history it';s worth a visit, and easy to get to. Everything here is close by
Fantastic and historical place. Fantastic and historical place. It will help you to get more educated, learn about history and enjoy the luxury and beauty of old times.

Fantastic NYE light show!!. On our way to visit the Palace we stopped for 20minutes to watch the light show. It was very well done, the crowds were managed well by the police and we really enjoyed it.
Well worth a visit!
Simply Beautiful.... From Church of the Savior on Spilt Blood 13 min walking Palace square which is so beautiful made huge palace..
Fabulous square with history overflowing!. Fbaulous place with colourful people and architecture. Lots of thinghs happening in and around the square.

Good Stroll. The Palace Square houses a 600 tonne "pillar" right in the center of it. Surrounded by the Hermitage, restaurants, and close to the sea. It is a happening square at night time where you can move around on segways or grab a quick bite. There are street performers all around.

Everywhere I could see, I saw open sapce. The square is huge and that is an understatement. Probably, second only to Red Square in its expanse. It is lined by The Hermitage on one side and another state gallery on the other. It's a great photo spot.
Perfect. Great place to visit. Beautiful views. If you would like to see the heart of Saint Petersburg you need to go there. This place is full of spirit of SPV

Spacious and beautiful. You haven't seen St Petersburg when you haven't been here. It is hard to imagine that this city was built 300 years ago. Peter the Great was inspired by Amsterdam. He had canals dug and built all these marvellous palaces and office buildings as well as mansions according his plans around vast squares and along wide streets. The outcome is stunning
A must. You simply can't miss this place if in St Petersburg. It's absolutely beautiful and something that simply takes your breath away

Nice!. Feel the history in the air! Really nice! Worth a visit! Gives you a perspective of how big the palace is and if you are interested in "Dekabrists" movement this is the right place to be! The very heart of the city!

Square with history. This square has seen its piece of history. 1905 Bloody Sunday took place here, long before the other Sunday, which U2 made famous.Square is surrounded by beautiful buildings, most remarkable being the Winter Palace.At Christmas time there is big Christmas tree at Square.

One of the outstanding places in Europe. Try to enter the square for the first time through the victory arch As this gives you the woo factor of seeing the winter palace in its full size also the square give all the buildings a perfect setting.Again if you can pass the square either in the fist light or late evening then the people who usually fill itt are absent and even in the mid winter the first snows are not disturbed and the buildings shine in their full majestyThis is setting that should not be missed and the good thing is that it is free to walk around and enjoy the setting
Stunning. Go at Christmas time when the big tree is upPretty horse drawn carriages adorn the place and when the snow is falling it is magical - my favourite place
Magical, especially at night. A short walk from our hotel. Very clean, safe, and stunning views. So much history to take in, enjoy a stroll around and then pop in a pub down one of the side streets.

B E A U T I F U L. Palace square is impressive for the space and the beauty of the buildings, all restaured to perfection. The Hermitage is a must and it makes you automatically reflect on Russia's recent history when palaces and churches were used as offices or warehouses. No trace is left and all or almost is back to its historic splendor. A walk just off Palace square at Nevski Prospect and/or the Neva embankment particularly when it is skin peeling cold and snow is crisp under your feet. Beautiful
Enormous square with fabulous architecture on 3 sides.. A must see in St Petersburg. Words cannot adequately describe the beauty of the architecture. Beautifully decorated at Xmas time.

Above all. Spirit of tsarism,scence of history,feeling of architectural inspirations-that is what Palace square means to most of people coming there. It's truly heart of the city with all important places of interests nearby. It's open 24/7. Come and enjoy

Impressive and beautiful, massive square with live concert at night (sometimes). Very beautiful and huge square! There was a concert on the day I visited (26th Dec), with the lights projecting onto the facade of the palaces and buildings, so pretty and impressive!

Great place with a nice view over the Winter Palace (Hermitage).. Great place with a nice view over the Winter Palace (Hermitage). If you have the chance to watch a concert there, don't hesitate, it's really a nice atmosphere.
Excellent. The view is superb, especially in summer, when in St. Petersburg, white night, it's nice to walk along the promenade, to get great pleasure from the beauty of the bridges.

Wealth and power of the Russian Emperors. This is definitely one of the most beautiful squares in the world. Even if you're visiting St. Petersburg just for couple of hours, the Palace Square is a must! The great spaces truly leave an impression of the wealth and power of former Russian Empire. Even if the weather is not nice, the Square is on the list.

a must see when you are in St.P but don't expect too much. The square itself is impressive from an architectural point of view but your impression will depend a lot on what's going on over there. Most of the cultural/important summits/installations/performances are done there...no cafes or places to sit and enjoy the view so just pla 10 - 15 min (if you are not a guided tour) and that's it.

Great for people watching. When visiting the Hermitage and the other galleries, you are sure to find yourself here, and it is a great place to see a variety of different people and vehicles. Lovely colours during sunset.

most impressive squares I've been on. It's huge,it's really very pretty.On one side Winter Palace=Hermitage, on the other- beautiful long building(forgot what it is now). Tall column in the center is standing by it's own weight- no cement of any kind-impressive.
Excellent place to take pictures.

More than a square. Once you get over the breathtaking architecture that surrounds the square... one you are less stunned by the massive expanse of the square... once your panoramic shots are done... once you're done pinching yourself for actually being here... just soak up the history. Don't go until you know that history, then stand there and let it flow through you.

Astunning experience!. What a beauty! Everything is fantastic, so solid, massive and beautiful. The atmosphere is stunning. The memorial of alexander the first is right at the center of it and when you look around yourself, you can feel the greatness of Russia.

Take a ride with horse and carraige. Great landmark, with beautiful views, great for stunning pictures! (Try a panoramic one!). The horse ride is worth it. It only takes 20 minutes (which is enough), but it gives this special dimension to visiting St Pete. And it is not expensive...
very nice. this square is the biggest suquare and nicesest one ,every side of it mind blowing I recomend you to go day time and evening beautiful at nigth with ligths

the Main Square. In the centre of the Square you can see 47meter Colomn devoted to Alexander.The Colomn designer is Montferrand who designed the famous St Isaac Cathedral.The Square is formed by the building of the Winter Palace on one side (=the Hermitage) and the General Head Quarters on the other side which since recent is also the part of the Hermitage and you can find temporary exhibitions there as well as impressionists are in the plan to be moved there.
Stunning!. The grandest of the Square is breathtaking. With the Royal Palace stretching across one side and the 'Winter Palace - Heritage Museum' on the other side.

Breathing Architecture. We were lucky enough to see school children performing a dance in santa outfits, 2 wedding parties including accordian player and dancing. The square had a hustle and bustle atmosphere.

Our only negative experience in the city. While walking across the square one afternoon, we were accosted by an EXTREMELY aggressive street vendor who got both physically and verbally abusive. Our only bad experience during our two week visit to the city.

Great Space. Unfortunately I arrived not long after the Russian plane was bombed over Egypt and the monument was been used as a memorial since so many of the passengers on the plane were from St. Petersburg. It was very sad to see the displays thinking of all those people that did not come home.What is surprising is the number of people who are walking around the square in period costume similar to what would have been when the Winter Palace was occupied.

Great view. One more amazing place...even winter, with cold wet snow falling around it is a great place. Having all the winter palace at a glance, the great column in the middle, the symetrical builfings aroud, the arch leading you back to the center...this great area to walk. Take metro, go out at Admiralteiskaia, walk all the way to Mednij vsadnik (the monument of Peter on a horse), continue along the river, and you will reach the Hermitage and behind it the squire....it is great walk...
Massive and impressive. This huge square is impressive to walk around on. Also a popular attraction for wedding pictures for those who want to see locals in wedding dresses.
Impressive building panarama. There is not really a lot to see here, but there is a nice view of many impressive buildings which surround the square.

Square with a history. During the day and at night impressive. This time especially due to all the flowers left there from mourning citizens (the terroristic attack on the plane from Egypt). Stand there and imagine yourself back about 150 years.
A wonderfull square with beautifull buildings. The square was not busy, the buildings are wonderfull, and grotesque, during the night the lightning is fairytale

Must see. A must see, but cannot say it is astonishing. If you start walking around the main landmarks in SPB you will surely reach it and see a crowd of tourist taking photos and waiting in the queue to access the museum.
Why was is not this area used for placing more attractions here? It is a mystery for me...
A large impressive space!. You can see this as part of your visit to the Hermitage. A good photo spot with lost of history attached to it.

The heart of St Petes.... Alexander stands proudly in the centre of of this historical square,surrounded by incredible buildings drenched in the history of this beautiful city.Bloody sunday,the revolution,end of the monarchy and the start of communism.Now pop concerts,celebration's and tourist's like me who just want to feel,learn and understand this great city's history.Many cities have their centres and their squares but nothing rival's Dvortsovaya Ploschad for it's shear beauty and splendour.
A must visit. You should definitely visit this place,the queues for the entry ticket was attest one kilometre long but once you reach inside WOW..don't miss the peacock clock
Cool square - Very Russian. Come here and feel your comrades presence, in a good way a very Russian feeling, a huge open space, mostly Tourists though.

Historical Memorable Square. Imagine, here you are standing in the square that saw the uprising of the Russian people of 1905 who marched in unison and peacefully to the Winter Palace to ask the Czar Nicholas at the time, for easier working hours, food, warm, rights..unfortunately this march did not go peacefully..it was very moving to me to stand here and realise that this was the exact spot where all this happened. And the reason for the beginning of the end to the Royal house in Russia..Fascinating history, read it if you can. This place is gorgeous in every way..the building is the same building, same colours as it was in those days..indeed as it has been since the 1700's and the time of Catherine the Great.

A reminder of the city's glorious days. Impressive square, witness of the Bloody Sunday (1905) and starting point of the 1917 October Revolution. In its center the world's tallest column out of red granite, the Alexander Column (1830–34), designed by Auguste de Montferrand. The most famous building is without doubt the Winter Palace (1754-62) to which it owes its name. Today this azure and white building hosts part of the Hermitage Museum collection. On the opposite side, a yellow and white building with a big arch, designed by Carlo Rossi (1819-1829) it's the Building of the General Staff. The eastern side is covered by Alessandro Brullo's building of the Guards Corps Headquarters (1837–43). The western side is open towards Admiralty square. Nowadays many concerts take place here by famous artists like Elton John, Andrea Bocelli, Duran Duran, Madonna etc.
Amazing. This is what I was hoping for in my visit to St. Petersburg: Large squares, imperial planning and architecture blending European styles. I was not at all disappointed.
Leisure. If you would like to see the past, live on it you should to be at musem Ermitage. You could get unforgatable feeling from this place.

Great for photos or a spot to sit and enjoy the views.. Central to the winter palace and has the Alexander Column in the middle. Our guide told us they sometimes has concerts there - when we went they were set up for the victory day celebrations.

Amazing buildings and its huge. We saw this square in all kinds of weather and time of the day - it seemed to change with the seasons. There are people dressed as Peter the Great and T shirt sale people around the edge of the square but they never were anything other than polite.

Grand Square in the heart of the old town. A must see and you will if you go to the Hermitage. Impressive size and surrounded by equally impressive/majestic buildings. One can just imagine the troops marching here for inspection by the Czar.

An amazing space. Palace Square is an amazing wide open space with no traffic other than people and possibly two horse drawn carriages. It houses the Hermitage and the General Staff Building, each showing the grand vista that it was and is today. In the centre of the square is the column dedicated to Tsar Alexander 1.
Impresive. Nice place, even during the evening, as it is very popular for street musicians. Also a lot of souvenirs during the day time.

Heart of st petersburg. I like this big square because it's in front of hermitag museum and you can take good photos of museum's facade and around (so beautiful) ,besides it has a nice cityscape of st Petersburg.
Huge complex. Do not miss the statue on top of the harmitage. U could spend the whole morning just walking around and finding all the detail they built into this place

Big big square with almost 360 degree landmarks around. Lively place with street musicians, several chariots (although I prefer not having them here because of the poor horses), and few people dressings as monarchs for you to take pictures with.
Trafalgar Square - Russian style. A vast open space surrounded on 3 sides by classical St Petersburg architecture. Don't forget your camera!

360 angel panorama view at front of hermitage!!. It look alike Vatican city but smaller and quieter. Big circle square where located in front of Winter palace. Horse cart riding services provided for visitor who ready to pay.

One of the most beautiful squares in the world. Grand, beautiful, perfect in proportions, historic!
Will recommend to anyone who is interested in architecture and/or history.

Incredible (especially at night!). If you visit St.Petersburg, you can't miss Palace Square, right in front of The Hermitage. It's size is just massive and I'd highly recommend visiting at night (for amazing photos). However, I was lucky enough to have visited morning, afternoon and night and it has such a different feeling at different times of day. All make for great photo ops but the nighttime is unreal. Palace Square offers a beautiful view of the Hermitage, the Alexander Column and the enormous curved General Staff Building, with its great triumphal arch and it's Chariot of Glory against Napoleon. Bring your camera!!!

Grand Space with Grand Views. Palace Square is immense and is flanked by the Hermitage. The massive column sits in the middle. It is a must see for photo opportunities. With the Hermitage entrance in the square it can't be missed.

Looks beautiful in night!!. This place should be experienced both in the day time as well as night time. It looks very different with each passing hour, during the night time it is fully illuminated and the feel is simply amazing.
A must see !!!. A must see !!! Place an impressive Deal Easy to reach, accessible to public transportation need to enter the museum itself. If not, you can skip Museums enthusiasts
Majestic. A lot to take in and a lot of ground to cover. Great views of the Hermitage from the square along with other sites.
Massive and impressive. This square if quite massive and the historical feeling from 1917 is very tense here. On one side is the Winterpalace and the other is the Ermitage.

Charming. It is very charming. When I was there, they were rehearsing drums for a concert. The sound of drums reflecting from the walls of Palaces was impressive. If there is a concert in this place you should not miss it
Jaw dropping!. What a square! My jaw literally dropped! I loved it so much that I went three times during different times of the day to take pictures. Loved it at sunset..

Worth your time.. It's right next to the State Hermitage Museum and an easy walk to the Nevsky Prospect. St. Petersburg is a beautiful city. Many great buildings. Expect to take endless photographs. I almost ran out of room on my card for the SLR camera I used. I recommend you take extra to make sure you have enough.
S. Petersburgh symbol. Is like le arc of triunfe in Paris. French style with Russian touch. This square has a lot of history. Hugh dimensions and impressive statue.

A sight to behold.. It's right outside the Hermitage, so you won't miss it if you're going there, but I had to stop and take many pictures of this marvel! The only thing I disliked was that it was hard to get everything into one picture!

What a place for a parade!. Large open space with a monolith monument to Alexander I in the center. The Hermitage on one side. The curved General Staff building with a chariot atop the arch through which the street leads to Nevsky Prospekt. Striking because of its size, the fine architecture of the buildings, and the harmony achieved among disparate elements. Only foot traffic, except for buses carrying tourists.

Impressive square that lets you feel the history. One of the most historically significant parts of the city, this square has been used as a meeting grounds for many of Russia s biggest historical events, and is not to be missed. The palaces and government/military command buildings make the square very imposing.

One of the highlights. This is a central place in the city, beautiful architecture. Beware of various locals that are dressed in classic Russian costumes that offer you to take a picture with them and then try to get your money. Worth to walk around.

One of the "must see places" in St. Petersburg. A definite must if one visits Saint Petersburg. Most of the other must see places are also close by so palace square is a good place to start or finish your trip.

How times have changed!. This grand square has so much history and is still the place for public gatherings. It was strange to see the Red Bull finish line for a charitable race set up against the background of the Hermitage. Check the public schedule to see some activity. It would be amazing to see this square full of people. It's HUGE!
Big and beautiful. With the Winter Palace, now the state Hermitage Museum on one side and Europes longest building (700m) on the other side this is a must see when you're in Saint-Petersburg.

Grand with imposing Alexander Monument which is a single piece of stone erected in the center of the square. Impressive square just perhaps bigger and grander than most of other Russian squares except Red Square. In the center Alexander monument is dedicated to the victory against Napoleon in 1812. Russia is a very proud nation, which is exhibited in most of their monuments - usually it's a monument memorizing their victories.
wow. one of those places that is actualy more impresive than you think it will be and i was there on national day so a big party

Worth a stroll around the Square. I really enjoyed the massive Square in front (or in the back of) the Winter Palace. There was always something happening. Whilst we were there, they had a big Tennis tournament there. We also saw a rock band play there and there's always old fashion horse buggies you could hire, or people dressed in the old dresses and outfits you could take a picture with etc.Nice atmosphere. Buzzing square.

Huge square. . The dimensions of this square and the buildings around it are incredible. You just have to stand there and look around you to understand the mentality that leaders had in those days, when a top priority was just showing off.
see this. Well it would be hard not to see this square as its pretty central to everything. Walk around and enjoy the views before your visit to the Hermitage

Historical, architectural site not to be missed. One of the longest buildings on one side, the Hermitage on the other and the magnificent Alexander column in the middle. Beautiful any time of day but especially at nighttime.
Beautiful square. An excellent place to visit just in front of the Hermitage. You can even try the segway which is just at 300 Rubles and allows you to take one round of the square.
Huge square. A huge square next to the Hermitage. Used for parade in modern times. In the centre of this beautiful city

huge square. Has the biggest lone standing statue in the world, The Alexander Monument, magnificently surrounded by the Hermitage and the General Staff Building. Important events in Russia's history has taken place here

Good place to hang, play football or just gaze. The palace square is broad an mostly free of traffic. You can look at all the buildings or play football like we did. Also used to military parades and concerts. metro stations are nearby.
Palace Square.. That is the Place. It is so big plaza. If you go to San Petersburg I am sure, you need to include a visit at Palace Square.

Awesome dimensions!. The dimension of this square is breath-taking. Made even more special because of the arched building on one side. And to think that Alexander's monument is not secured - the column just sits centered on the base - awesome!

The most important square in SPB. A very nice place where you can see social events and many people of different nationalities...
Times and again there are small bands playing music, dancing, playing skateboard and many many other activities in the open space here...

Historic Square - Wide Open Space - Great Photo Ops. Go very early in the morning. This is definitely a tourist attraction so it fills up. We went around 8:00 am when there was a concert set-up going on and we had quite a bit of the square to ourselves. You get a sense of how large the square is as you walk in and imagine how many people it would take to fill the area.
Breathtaking!. What an amazing square, you can feel the history all around, close your eyes and imagine Catherine the Great rolling up in her carriage on visits!

Vast Square Indicating Historical Migth and Riches of Czarist Russia. An awesome sight of a vast, eye-opening square that is larger than similar palace squares that exist in Western Europe. When walking in the square can feel the might of Czarist Russia in its heyday. Well-worth spending a half-hour just wandering around and feeling the historic atmosphere.

Impressive. A large beautiful square as you would expect in Russia. Beautiful place with cobblestones located next to Hermitage. I was astounded by the beauty. Everyone should make sure to see Palace Square in the daytime, and in the evening, as even at 9.30pm we had bright sunshine.
Nice square. Big square were they try to sell you different activities. Be carful when you see people dressed historical style. You need to pay for the pictures. Otherwise nice view.
Go at night!. We stayed right by here. You will most certainly go if you are visiting the Hermitage but do yourself a favor and visit at night when no one is around. It is beautifully lit up.

Great feeling of open space like a Stadium. Palace Square is the place where Tourists hang around after visiting Winter Palace, St. Issacs' Cathedral and several other Monuments in the near vicinity. This place is also used for Concerts. Its so vast that it can be compared with a Ground of large Soccer Stadium.
Place Square. Get there early to avoid the crowds. Great to visit at night, to see it and the Hermitage with all its lights on, only a short walk to Palace Bridge and Nevesky

beautiful scenery. people say we should go into the Hermitage but we did not. We just stay out doors at the square. the view is beautiful. it wasnt crowded so we dont feel that it is dangerous. There are some tourist buses around. Not many stalls like other tourist places.
Huge square. The square leading to the entrance of the Hermitage. The biggest square in St. Petersburg. Not as crowded as other sights.
A full of history place. A market full of history, history that you can not feel. Now just a crossing point and a photo point.

Palace square; this is large. This square is extremely wide and with very nice building surrounded, i.e. Hermitage. Most of the square is free from cars. This enormous square is always full of people (tourist), often special happenings take place. Several nice buildings surround the square, the most famous is the Hermitage. On the square the column shows his enormous height to the people.

Grand square with a interesting history. We came to the square when we went on the Free Walking Tour of S:t Petersburg. It is really grand and the story about the monument is just interesting in itself.

a vivacious place. no wonder it's always filled with people when having the hermitage winter palace on one side and the hermitage general staff building on the other side. to name just two of the interesting spots facing palace square. I've seen people perform on the square during day and at night. and there are concerts and other cultural things held, too, every now and then. worth resting and enjoying the view and the motion at day and night.
A large square, good for pictures but nothing much to do there. It is a large square in front of the Hermitage Museums. In the evenings, performers display their skills there.

Early Visit showed fewer people, but later there were so many people there !!. We went to the Palace Square on our first morning !!! We had grabbed an early breakfast and the whole of the area was without cars and there were only about 20 people there. So we did some photography and enjoyed the space. We went back later and there were so many people there - all sightseeing and trying to go to the Winter Palace !! If you can go there early it is far better for photography !!!

It's so damn BIG!. Palace Square is a very famous spot in St. Petersburg. On your way to the Hermitage you will pass through here so, assuming you're going to the Hermitage (I think it's actually a requirement!!) you can't but see this square. It's absolutely HUGE. There's often concerts, events, gatherings, military band practice (that's a doozie if you get the opportunity to see it) and much, much more going on here. My kids used to take rollerblading classes here!! What a location. If it's got a slight dusting of snow in early winter, it looks like someone sprinkled sugar on it. Fabulous. The views from all directions are wonderful so take heaps of pics but watch out for Peter the Great and Catherine roaming around, waiting for unsuspecting tourists. They are there for your money, NOT for you to make cutesy little photos to post on facebook for free!!

City's heart. The main Square of the city, conviniently located in the begginnig of Nevsky prospect, with metro station Admiralteyskaya nearby, plenty of restaurants with multi-lingual menu also at your desposition. You can take the Grande cirle walk tour to start from Plashchad Vosstaniya, Nevsky and The Palace Square. After Palace Square go to Palace Bridge, cross and you will be surprised to see Peter And Paut Frtress just in front of you. On the Square always something happens - military and weapon expositions, moto&biker shows, green loans, concerts. Great photo opportunities with Winter Palace, espescially if the line inside is huuuge. Great River Neva views. There is toilet fasilities, souvenir stands, fast food stalls. Wheelchair access only through Nevsky Prospect. Have a walk arouns admiring beautiful views both in winter ans summer

The Palace Square is extensive and at the same time is very cozy. The Palace Square is extensive and at the same time is very cozy. In the center of the square the column is installed made from a single piece of granite. It's dedicated to Emperor Alexander the First, in honor of Russia's victory over Napoleon in the war of 1812. In those times some citizens of St. Petersburg, passing in a carriage by the Palace Square feared that Alexander's Column might fall on them. But the column still stands intact.
Worth a quick stop. Grand square typical of many around Europe in capital cities. Worth a visit for the buildings that surround the square

Humongous square!. We were there for the red sails celebration, I think all of Europe was there, at least the young people, about 20,000. Scary also when you think the revolution began there. We walked in the steps of history.

Main square in the city. The palace square can be considered the main square in St Petersburg surrounded by impressive buildings of different architectural styles.It brings together the baroque winter palace on northern side and classical building of former Imperial Army General Staff on the southern side.Two wings of this buildings is joined by a triamphal arch.In the middle of the square is the Alexander column.
Better than Red Square!. It's free and worth visiting at sunset when the sun reflects off the buildings and the crowds depart.

Dramatic square of St Petersburg. Seen this a few times in films and tv and always wanted to stand in it. A great experience but not as I had it in my head. Didn't help seeing workers with cranes putting up seating and ruined the view. Tired of visiting places that are not kept as they should be. Took as many pics as I could but need a panorama shot camera to capture the full experience.
palace square. a large square with nice views. located at the beginning of Nevsky Prospekt. large crowds gather in this place.
A large historical square. Full of story here. Lucky to see the march.Everything is big and long distance to walk even you can see it's close.

Beautiful square with great views of The Heritage.. Beautiful square with great views of The Heritage, opportunities to hire Segways or have your photo taken with an actor in classical Russian attire. A great place to whip out your sketchpad or notebook.

A must see. An impressive square surrounded by beautiful buildings well maintained. From here a lot of other attractive places are reachable by foot. During many weekends there are things to do, concerts or parades.

Huge square with bloody history. Huge square between the Winter Palace, the Hermitage and the General Staff Building. The square have a lot of history, even some very bloody parts. The fun fact about the column in the middle of the square, its standing there only on pure gravity.

Huge Open Space. Once used for military parades & political gatherings. It is surrounded by beautiful buildings & The Hermitage. Not as large as Tiananmen in Beijing, but still quite significant. Nice statue to Peter the Great. We were there very early...so there were only a few people strolling around.
Amazing space. What a great space for the locals to have for any Occassion that suits. Beautiful buildings surround and a honeypot for tourists

The right place for visiting Hermitage, mobile bridges and for entertainment in the weekend nights.. In weekend, in this square take place ad-hoc concerts, bands and solo singers come and entertain the visitors. The square is huge and it is very nicely lit in the night. Also, 1 minute away to the "mobile bridges".
Visit to Palace Square. Right opposite the Hermitage Museum, this is such a colossal ground and the statue of Peter the Great!
A vast space. Avery large square so did not get too crowded,there were horse drawn carriages to hire.the down side was the temporary toilet block in the corner that smelt

Beautiful huge Square in fron of the Hermitage Museum. This is the Palace Square in front of the Hermitage Museum; we were there several times; it is huge and beautiful. The best time to visit it is in the evening when they have performers and musicians doing their thing.

Grande and impressive. The square is huge and on every side there are beautiful buildings to admire. The Hermitage/Winter palace, the arch that leads to Nevskiy Prospect and so on. We saw load of people relaxing on the square, longboarding, skateboarding or just chatting. Good atmosphere in a pretty environment.
Big Square in St Petersburg. A massive square in the midst of St. Petersburg. Very similar feeling to Red Square and adjacent to the Hermitage museum.
Impressive. Huge square surrounded by the Hermitage State museum and its associated buildings. There's plenty of buskers and street food vendors here. Very picturesque.

Huge Square near the Hermitage. Palace Square is absolutely huge, reminded me of the square in Krakow. A bit barren but houses lots of important Russian historical buildings, can imagine it being crazy at a concert or sports event!

The courtyard of the Hermitage. Love the historic square which was the courtyard between the palace and administrative offices for the palace. Not used for public gatherings, concerts, touristy horse and carriage rides and a place for brides- among other things I'm sure. I asked our guide if it was also a place for demonstrations ( knowing Russia isn't a place for that kind of activity) and she said" no the government doesn't like that".
The sheer size of it is amazing!. Everything is so large in St Petersburg and the same is true of this Square. It's a great place to take pictures and to walk around

Grand square to rival any in the world. Truly a grand square. Built to mirror others from around the world. This is a beautiful place and grand entrance to the city. Easy to walk from here to The Church of the Spilt Blood and onto Nevsky Prospect.
Wonderful . A square that faces the hermitage..a nice place to spend some time and take photos. There is a column of Peter the great that commemorate his victories. Enjoy.
Palace Square. The sheer size is awesome and the place is worth seeing. However, not much time is required and one can spend as little as 15 minutes
big square. this place is always full of people coming to Hermitage museum. It is a big square. That statue in the middle of the square is impressive too. It is close to Nevsky Square.

Dvortsovaya Ploshchad after Dark. Most tourists venture down to Palace Square during the day to visit the Hermitage/Winter Palace, but the locale is well worth a bit of 'a butcher's' at night too. The lit-up Hermitage looks spectacular at nightfall (in August this means after about 10pm!) as does the Carlo Rossi-designed arch of the adjacent General Staff Building. The massive square is relatively depopulated after dark but there are still people leisurely strolling past the landmark of the towering Alexander Monument at this time. It is also when skateboarders move in to take full use of its wide, open spaces. Warning: it is not necessarily a quiet place to hover after dark as motor bike riders take advantage of less traffic to regularly tear round the very broad circumference of the square late in to the evening.

Maybe the Russian Vatican Square.... A very beautiful square just on the exit of Hermitage Museum. Despite the fact that you usually see it after the amazing Hermitage, it is still worth spending some time there. Through the arch you can go straight on Nevsky Avenue. As most of the attractions in St Petersburg do visit it at night also.
Nice. Square next to the Hermitage, right in the city centre. You will cross it when you will visit the Hermitage.

Huge Expanse surrounded by amazing buildings. Great around sunset when the crowds have gone. The sheer scale of the place is amazing. The western portion is a skateboarders/roller bladers paradise so watch you don't get knocked over. In the main area carriage rides can be taken.

An area you will visit. The large area in front of the Winter Palace & Hermitage Museum is an area local youth skate (& there is plenty of room for this), groups use as a meeting place, an opportunity to have your photo taken with someone in period costume, a horse & carriage ride or just the place to go day or night to get a magnificent photo of the Winter Palace & Hermitage Museum.
Great place. We saw it and love it . Very impressive place to see when you visit this lovely town . It surrounde by great building. Not far from the bridge that open .

Soak up the atmosphere of this wonderful open space. Capture the moment - plenty of great camera shot from various angles and take time to look all around you slowly. Nice little kiosk to the side selling cheap food despite the location
Photo stop. It's a photo stop on you way into the Winter Palace, but an impressive square, and worthy of a few moments.
A must see. Stunning square and view. Highly recommend to walk around and spend time people watching. Beautiful views!

A square on such a grand scale that you must see!. Just outside the Hermitage Museum. Not something you need to spend a lot of time at but is a definite stop on any tour. The enormity of the area is just so impressive.
Very enjoyable and a huge square. Huge place and you are never short of entertainment with all the constant activity. Adds value to the Hermitage
Worth going to. It takes a while to take in the sheer size of this square - surrounded by amazing buildings & structures

Around everything. Go thru Boshoy Morskoy ulitsa from Newsky ounly 100m and you are there.Huge "ploschad"in front of Heremitage Palace.Just great beautifull buildind around this place,Normally a lot of peoples queuing to museum or just spend time on this area.Ounly walking distance from most popular atractions blood church,Isac church,Plalace bridge,canals and so on.

Don't miss - and it's free. Just stand in the middle of the square and imagine what must have gone on here over the last few centuries. A little in need of attention / cleaning etc. but has a quite impressive feel to the place.
Great place.. Very impresssive place.Should be visited both during daytime and night as the lights in the night make it look more impressive and great.
Beauty. The Palace Square is an absolute must -- the sheer size of it, its perspectives in all directions, and the sense of history it gives are unbeatable. True architectural beauty.
A lot of Cement!!!. A lot of Cement!!! Very cool place to check out! Didn't spend a lot of time there but a very nice place!!!

Watch out for the guys selling caviar!! they are rude and very annoying!!. This square it is very beautiful but unfortunately there are a lot of bad people just waiting for the tourists to arrive and bother them trying to sell caviar and different goods in bags they are walking around with a bad full of them, they are very pushy and very rude, I said no thank you to one of them and it kept bothering my family for us to buy caviar at the same time doing obscene signs, I said please stop loudly and he left his things on the floor and took his racket off like he wanted to fight with me. We left immediately.

all round panoramic view with lots of history. We walked around from a small side road with our TJ Travel guide to this enormous open space with beautiful buildings and quirky horse drawn carriages. We learnt a bit of history from our guide too.

Nerd heaven part two! . I was standing in the very place where Bloody Sunday had taken place which triggered the 1905 Revolution and was genuinely giddy with excitement to be in the square I'd seen in textbooks. It's huge, well preserved and, as you can see from my photo, I was pleased to be there! A sight to behold before entering Winter Palace. Recommended for Russian Revolution enthusiasts!

Impressive square, modeled after the Vatican. This was a beautiful square. Just plan to pass through it during your visit to other things. It is very large and not very crowded, which was great for photos!

Grand Square - Political & Cultural Centre of St. Petersburg. Grand plaza with the Winter palace with the Hermitage Museum fronting onto it. This is the historical centre of the city, near the Neva and many other historical sites..a must to walk through!

a great photo op.. we were lucky to witness the harley davidson festival there. hundreds of bikers with their tattoos and their babes.also a wonderful history lesson for the kids abt the russian revolution and winter palace.

Vast. Not much more to say!. This is a bit of an odd one. You walk through this to get to so many other sites in St Petersburg so you don't really need to polan to go to it. It just happens. It is abaolutely vast!

Twice as big as Kremlin square. The unique arrangement of buildings makes the square along with the monument in the middle.
Try to come in the morning when the crowds are sparse. You can take really nice pictures, plus the size when the square is empty is much easier to feel.

Beautiful landmark. You approach the Hermitage and Winter Palace from this square and it is an impressive square and be sure to take pictures of the Hermitage and Winter Palace. Despite the crowds, they are lost in this vast space. Impressive statue in the middle
Can't miss this one!. If you are in St. Petersburg only for a day, you can't miss this one! Probably one of the world's most famous (and certainly one of the most magnificent!) squares. Go!
Wow! Big place!. Husband & I visited Palace Square on the same day we went to the Hermitage Museum as they are right together. Pictures cannot do this place justice.

A Landmark. The Palace square also the Alexandre square is massive with the Winter Palace on one side the administrative buildings opposite with one side leading to Nevasky Prospekt connected to the bridge. It is a very central point in Saint Petersburg having horse carriage rides and people dressed in costumes of the retro era to pose with the tourists for photography.

Exit from the Hermitage. We approached this square by exiting the Hermitage.We didn't walk around it, just had our photo taken by the guide. However, it was impressive, as we had entered the Hermitage in the rain, but approached the square in the sun. What a difference!

perfect place to click nice pics of people and the buildings. Just sit there and relax watching the movements of different kinds of people .good place to sit and relax and to admire the grand buildings on either side /the park nearby gives ample shade to give rest to our body& mind after visiting the grand museum
Impressive. Standing in the centre of this square really make you feel the magnitude of this truly beautiful place. As the first image of Russia it didn't disappoint.
palace square. just in the heart of Hermitage museum is the palace square with a tall tower in the middle of it.you can have a great pleasure by walking in Hermitage outdoor.

Petty much spacious. So large a stone paving square with a symbolic column of Alexander.... Those who visit the Hermitage Museum will surely pass through this square. Visitors enjoy taking pics, chatting, walking.. so comfortable if it is a breezy summer day. Lots of eating stalls are available, just wondering the square is also fun.

Take in the magnificence. Visited twice. In the morning, it was bright, expansive and the buildings around the square were magnificent. In the night, the square was alive with buskers playing music and people passing by just dancing to the beats. The buildings are wonderfully lit and I recommend a visit both during daylight and night!

Angel on the top.. The square is big, clean and open.
I hear that Stalin planed to take the angel down from the pillar and put a statue of Lenin in stead. That tells us that ones live time is shorter than you think.

Wow!!!. A spectacular centre point of a beautiful city. Five minutes walk from Admiralteyskaya metro. There are reasonably priced souvenir stalls and fast food stalls nearby, a Burger King around the corner on Nevsky Prospekt for loos and drinks. Also guides offering boat trips- again most are reasonably priced at R600 (£6.50) an adult. Be aware of pickpockets but there are plenty of police around.

Among the larger squares you will see. The sheer size of this square blows the mind. Flanked by wonderful buildings and located near major sites like The Hermitage, it should be on your list. A wonderful area to walk around.

Magnificent. After I walked by the river Neva I went to the Palace square. it was so impressive.  its size is enormous. the buildings surrownding it are magnificent. There were horse carts to hire if you want a tour around. Beautiful scenery.

Awesome. The square is not actually square, as the buildings on one side are curved. What captures the eye is the magnificent Alexander Column soaring to great height and dominating the space, just as the Hermitage Museum dominates one side. The square must be one of the largest open spaces in any city.

Felt that I belong here !. I might not be able to put it in exact words about the feeling that I had..If you stand right at the centre and have a look, suddenly you will realize that you are surrounded by State of the Art Architecture. I realized that I belong here and don't want to go back home. I belong here in SPB !!

Wow just wow. We went here a few times in our four day visit, both during the day and at night.This square is massive and very impresive .At night it is all lit up with specially placed spotlights.A must see..

Great chill out spot during the summer. Right in front of hermitage, this square is huge! So many things happening around the square, I'm sure everyone will be passing by here at some point. Since it was summer, locals were just hanging out on the square doing some skate boarding, chatting, drinking...(Which is technically not allowed in Russia?)A good place for photos too!

Lovely. What a wonderful experience to be in this place of such great historical importance. Each time I visit, I am astounded by the beauty. Everyone should make sure to see Palace Square in the daytime, and in the evening.
Its huge. The palace square is certainly huge, and what stunning views it has of the winter palace. I spent quite some time here taking in the magnificent sights

Awesome . I obviously had read about this place but seeing it for yourself is absolutely better than you expect. It's just outside the hermitage and you have to have a walk around before or after visiting the museum. There are people in costume walking around who will ask to do photos with you for cash. I suppose if that's your thing why not but if not just politely say no. Really gorgeous architecture in perfect condition. Absolutely fantastic
Majestic Square. It is so large and breath-taking. It will stop you in your tracks as you just spin slowly to take in all of the area and imagine what it looked like a hundred years ago.
Definitely a spot to check out. Very beautiful. A good place to take a stroll and people watch. Enjoy the street entertainers and catch a drink at one of the many cafes.

Huge. huge square. Good place for kids to run around or sit after a long Hermitage tour. Nothing else to do here really. You can see the buildings and the architecture is quite cool. When we were there, some areas were cordoned off for the victory parade preparations
Imposing. Designed by Carlo Rossi. This is where the Bloody Sunday massacre of 1905 took place. About 1000 demonstrators perished on the 9th of January 1905.
White nights. Lovely to see so many people out enjoying themselves late at night. In the day time it is also a wonderful sight. Perfect arena to set off the splendour of the Winter Palace.
Great. Beautiful place to take pictures, where you can see the Winter palace and General staff building. The architecture is amazing.

beautiful all around the 360º. before entering the Hermitage Museum, take some time to admire this massive square and take some pictures of the many buildings that sorround it, remembering the many historical events it has witnessed throughout Russian History...

Impressive. . If you are visiting the Hermitage Museum you will see this and it is just an impressive square. Hard to imagine it full of people and the events that are/were held here. Large, old, iconic. A sight to see.
IMPRESSIVE. As every other major tourist attraction in St. Petersburg, Palace Square is worth seeing. Right behind the Hermitage so you see it when you go to the Hermitage.

"Surrounded by art..". The greatest piece of news about the square is that all the buildings around it are now the homes of the collections of the State Hermitage Museum! Those interested in the history of Alexander's column, could visit the Peter and Paul Fortress, where there is a free exhibition on historic St Petersburg, which includes the documents, sketches, visualization, and films about "How Montferrand did it" from cutting, through transportation and installation. Rather inspiring :)

Built and laid out to impress visitors to the Royal court. You enter the square via theTriumph Arch from a non descript side street. Then the whole impressive vista opens up before you. The squre is vast and relly impressive and was built to show off Russias might. It is one of the biggest squares in Europe. The Arch is sorrounded on each side the Buildings of the General Staff and the Guard Corps Headquarters and to its front the iconic and famous Winter Palace. Set in the middle is the overpowering Alexander Column rising 47.5 meters to commerate the defeat of Napoleon in 1814. After the line had gone into the Winter Palace the Square looked vast and imposing with just a few tourist carriages and actors in period costume touting for a picture shoot. Very different from Bloody Sunday in 1905 when tens of thousands of protesting workers and their families were mowed down by volleys from the Imperial Guard and other troops and the storming of the Palace by the Bolsheviks in the October revolution of 1917. Often used for outdoor concerts.
Another must see of St. Petersburg!. Spacious and beautiful square with a stunning arch on one end. A must see! Backs up to famous Hermitage.

Large and beautiful!. A large beautiful square as you would expect in Russia. Beautiful place with cobblestones located next to Hermitage. Picturesque horse carriages to take you for a ride and lots of activities. Watch your valuables. Of course you will go!

Impressive Iconic Sqaure. I happened to be there on the day they have a rehearsal for a military march. Got to say it is quite a good extra experience for this trip.The square itself is as grand as you could expect for a Russian iconic place. Must visit indeed!

Spacious as one would expect in Russia. This square is very spacious and shows the grander of the Russian Plazas. Stage coach rides are offered for a high penny if one would like to take it around the plaza. They advertise it as a city tour, but it is only a tour of the square.

LArge impossing Square. The square is quite stark in front of hte museum. IT is extremely large and I foun dit a very long walk from end to end. when we were there before the 70th anniversary the troops were constantly parading and most of the traffic around was blocked off it. There are far better things to see in the city

Big square next to Hermitage. The Palace Square is a nice big square that is surrounded by the Hermitage museum. They have some vendors along the edges selling food, souvenirs etc. Besides the column in the middle its really just a nice open space. You will probably visit it anyways as its between the original Hermitage in the Winter Palace and the new wing where they moved all the modern paintings.

mesmerizing. the huge square with the hermitage winter pallace in torquise and white, the colomn in the middle and the half circle pallace on the other side is a magnificent view at all hours of the day. The sun ligt changes along the day and by that it elighten different parts of the square whan light intensity and tone change, this is great. During the white nights there is a lot of activity on the square with small groups of musicuants and other street shows.

Large Expansive Square. You Can't Miss It.. You'll easily see this square should you go to the Hermitage Museum. Across the square is another build with beautiful arches. It also holds the Hermitage's modern art collection. Which shouldn't be missed.
It's a square. Lots of events take place in this square. It's large but not that special other than the Hermitage is here.

Adjacent to Hermitage and the Admiralty. Waiting to visit the Hermitage, we walked across to the Palace Square. An open large square with bustling crowds, it is a sight to behold. The wondrous Alexander Column looms large within it. The Admiralty building on one side looks grand while the Hermitage is adjacent to it. The road from here leads to Nevsky Prospekt, the main street of St. Petersburg, which has many a stupendous building

Can't believe is so BIG AND NEXT TO THE WINTER PALACE!!. Visited in OCTOBER 2012, like Tian An Men Square, this Square is perhaps the second largest in the world. In the centre features the statue of a hero in Russia, Peter the Great! Then on one side to the northwest, is the Hermitage Museum/Winter Palace, then the other side the Art Institute of Petersburg which many of the finest artists of Russia were born! You can also find occasionally some locals dressed up as the czar/czarina, red coat soldiers who you can take photos with for merely 150-200 rubles...cheap and sexy)

See What Life is--. Palace Square is full of life. It is great to see people enjoying life- in all its varieties! Nice place for a leisurely walk, skating, cycling -- you name it. Have a walk- see monuments around- visit any of the many restaurants around-- you will really enjoy. Have a nice experience.

Walking Arena. As you head towards The Hermitage, you'll walk across a huge square. Before and around the sides of The Hermitage are the cart vendors for souvenirs and novelties - as well as entertainers and coffee/drink vendors. The size is immense - use panoramic view when taking photos. When I went through in the morning, reenactment characters were also present for photo ops. At night, local police are present as I noticed last night walking around 11 pm. The square was filled with lively people.
Great!. This place gives a view of Russia's great history. All military parades and huge events happen there. One of the must see places in St. Petersburg.

Historic Square...!!!!. The former city square of the Old Russian Empire, this square its famous for holding the 1905 Bloody Sunday and the 1917 October Revolution. A massive square just in front of the Hermitage Museum, its a popular destination where carriages, skaters and tourists mix up. The statue in the middle its Alexander Column, a 50 meters tall column thats unique of its kind. A true historic place to wonder around...
Perfection. Just pretend that you're a member of Decabrist revolt, awaiting for the guillotine... The history is there, speaking to your ear. You are in the presence of all who ever been here.A must
Magnificent but cold. It was a surprise to be walking around this magnificent place, witnessing such an amazing culture, but we went the first week of november and it was freezing!!!

Big. The sheer size of this place will amaze you. Horse-drawn carriages and skateboarders, buskers and photographers, tour groups and disaffected youth, you'll find it all. Note that the marble column is a good meeting point.
Awe-inspiring!. So, so big. Just go and see and stand. The brilliance of the planning and design will excite you. Fun to just be here and say, "I'm in Russia right now!"

Stunning space. Large paved square surrounded by majestic building. Plenty of sun and shade. Felt a little dwarfed by the architecture. We were rushed by our guide, so not able to fully enjoy the space.

EPIC!!. The palace square is larger than the red square (almost double its size). It's famous for Alexander's column and the winter palace. However what I like about it, is that walking in any direction from the square you will find cool attractions. In one direction you can find St. Isaac's Cathedral. In another you will be in Nvesky prospect.. Etc The square has a spirit of Royality. You can see how Russia in Caesar's time looked like. A must visit of course.

St. Petersburg is most beautiful Russian City!. I love this city and its athmosphere! The square is big, but the view to the winter palace makes it look epic, may be that is why it is so famous, so many things chenged there... The best time to go there is June/July the white nights time, romantic! :)
majestic. as everything in Russia: majestic.. here everythign seems to have different ways of measures... everything is majestic and this square is a clear example of it

Amazing square!. Amazing large square, the place what you can see a lot of times by TV or in the Russian movies. It is nice to walk here. Just need to take in mind that it is possible to feel strong wind all the time. Take some scarf with you!

Beautiful. Great for people watching. . When we first got there, there were not many people. Turns out the Hermitage is closed on Mondays. But we did get to see a music video being filmed. It was funny to see the cameras and all the trendy looking make back up dancers surrounding the female singer. They would dance to music for a few seconds and then stop. Tourists would be wandering around and locals would bike past. Of course people dressed as Peter and Catherine would look to be paid to pose in pictures. Fun.

Big!. A very large square,paved,with lovely buildings all around,inclusing the Hermitage. Come from the direction of the arch,and it opens out into a vast area. But be carefull,traffic still drives around part of the square,and fast!
A must-see In St Pete's!. A must-see In St Pete's! The open square is amazing even if you aren't visiting the Hermitage, just wander around and take it in! Shame about all the segway tours!!

Large impressive square. Passed through Palace Square after leaving the Hermitage Museum. It is a massive square and was being set up with a huge stage for an evening celebration. We were on a cruise excursion, so unable to return for the festivities. Quite impressive setting.

Perfect. Large and magnificent! The main square of the city. Every day there is a new story.
A wonderful place for a stroll.
crowed most days. very fun but a lot of people all the time. This place holds a lot of concerts and other events, so head down now and then to see if something is happening here.

Has to be seen to be believed. The sheer size of it is breath-taking - photographs we had seen did not prepare us for scale of the real thing. Most people will see it as part of their visit to the Hermitage museum, but it's worth making a special visit to it early in the morning before the crowds arrive, which brings home the vastness. Seeing it on a sunny spring morning makes it difficult to imagine that the events of 'Bloody Sunday' in 1905 took place here, so make sure you read up your guide book or history book to get the full story.

A huge square that is definitely worth a stop.. We went to the square on a private tour the day before Victory Day. After visiting the Hermitage museum this is a good option for your next stop. Alexander Column is in the middle with the General staff buildings and Winter Palace surrounding it. We were there late afternoon in early May when it was very quiet so you could take in the vastness of the square. At the time they were setting a stage up for Victory Day as well as many banners.

Beautiful!. Behind the Winter Palace, this is a picturesque place to be, in front of you the Palace, behind you the Staff building, and you know that they started the attack of the Winter Palace from here in 1917 - a piece of history, a must see in SPB!

It is huge!. Et the one end is Hermitage museum-Winter palace. The opposite side of the square is General stuff building. Et the center of square is Alexander column. It's beautiful, amazing and really,really big - until you see squares in Moscow ;)

A whole day visit. Palace square included the winter palace and hermitage museum. Its really big and would take almost a day to finish. Of you want to go into the museum make sure u come early because the queue was so long. So many people queue up to buy the tickets.

Big. Breathtaking square with hermitage one side, Alexander's column in the middle and the staff buildings with archway on the other sides. The Impressionist museum is secreted away here and well worth a visit on your hermitage ticket.

picturesque square. the plane surface under the blue sky gives you the sense of being in the heaven. when you go to the hermitage do not forget to exit from the place square to visit the one of the most beautiful squares in the world.
Tourists be warned - pickpockets!. It is best to visit this expansive square early in the day, as pickpockets show up as the crowds gather during the day. BE WARNED!

Not only an historic place but an access to Museum Hermitage. Keep in mind that all impressionists have been move in general staff house on this place - opposite Hermitage you have now a great new modern renovated museum with all our French Impressionists.. you will enjoy this new part of Hermitage - then just walk near the Neva and enjoy the view on Peter Paul fortress and by night our bridges opening...
Must visit in St Petersburg. A place that is grand with stunning spaces and architecture with tourists and locals having great fun. A place that dwarfs you with its grand scale
We enjoyed a lot . Because this huge square had lots of local Russians enjoying the space - kids on roller blades; families having a picnic; ordinary people having some free time.

Integral to visits to Hermitage, General Staff site. Amidst a Europe rich in grand plazas, Palace Square takes it place, its grandeur integral to realization of the power of Imperial Russia emanating in the Square with the Hermitage and the General Staff surrounding.

Very nice place for a visit . Great Square to walk around and take some great pictures, it's located in the heart of the city and next to winter palace.I would rate it highly to visit, hard not to see as its so big.Other things to also see around the area and many places to grab something to eat.

Good for strolling, wondering or listening. We saw some great concerst on the square which made it even more interesting while it would be amazing without any additional entertainment already. Beautiful building around, the smell of history everywhere.

Neat place. This place is Huge! It's the backyard of Hemritage and often very busy during the summer. People walking, sitting and just chilling around. The square is also known for arranging of different "happenings" like once I was there during some motorcycle event - it was full of motorcycle gangs and cool bikes. Anyway, make sure you walk through it at least :)
Incredible. Huge square and everywhere you look, you see something great, like Hermitage. Must see in St. Petersburg
Inmense. Right where the Hermitage and the General Staff buildings are, you cannot miss it. We saw a great concert when we were there

One of the Largest Main Squares. Massive square surrounded by the Winter Palace and vast government buildings. Our tour visited here the day before Russia was going to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the defeat of Germany and there were extensive displays of military equipment in process and can only imagine what the parade the next day would be like.

Heart of the city. Definitely this square is the touristic and official heart of the city. Must visit for a tourist and city visitor. Too pompous, formal and enormous to my mind. The square is the place for all city's major events like Victory Day, Scarlet Sails festival, day of the city 27 May, New Year as well as for rock concerts. Madonna once made her show on the Palace Square. However during the evening it is empty of people — the life continues at Nevsky the opposite direction close to Vosstania Square with its shopping malls, eateries and restaurant street of Rubinshtein.

Just filled with architectural splendour. Huge space with amazing buildings and a Russian marching band. Not sure that they were there every day but they were there for us, in their big bearskin hats. Fantastic.

The beating heart of the city!. This is to me the main city centre which must be visited by every tourist going to St. Petersburg. The square is enormous with all kind of activities going on there. There are many souvenir stalls around the square too. You just have enough time to take a photo as proof of visiting the city? ...then this is the place to be at!

Not to be missed. A big square with a lot of people always there. Stand and look around in all directions and you will see great places to photo and visit. At one side of the square is the Hermitage museum and Winter Palace and directly opposite the General Staff Building with a passageway leading to the main shopping area of Nevsky Prospekt. From the square you can see the Admiralty and St Isaac cathedral's dome. In the middle of the square is the Alexander Column on top of which sits an angel holding a cross.
this is a must!. that is definitely a must-see! you surely won't leave this place without taking a number of pictures)) #1 to visit!

St Petersburg at its finest. Palace Square is quite an experience. The Winter Palace, the General Staff Building the floor and the column, it all creates a fabulous atmosphere. On a sunny day, with a blue sky above you and everything glistening it is almost too much to take in, it is so stunning. There are many souvenir and food stalls around the square perimeter and we were very fond of the corn on the cob vendors, which sell absolutely delicious sweetcorn that makes a healthy, delicious and light lunch while walking the square. There are toilets on the square near the winter palace end, which are around 30 rubels per person.

beatiful square. I thing it not an exaggeration to say that it is of the most beatiful square in the world. The Winter Palace and army head quarter building with its magnificent Arch and the Alexander Column in the middle of the square is wonderful. ypu will definetly have a nice with full of activities and performances by singers, dancers .
